required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Contact to Dogs During Stressful Situations
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Contact to a Dog During Standardised Stressful Situations

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will conduct an experimental study comparing responses of healthy participants in two test situations where they are subjected to mild stress. The study design is a randomised controlled crossover design nested within two groups - one with a dog present and another without a dog present. The participants will be randomly allocated to two groups (with dog and without dog) and the participants will receive both test situations on the same day. During the two test situations the participants will be subjected to a classical stress test , and exposed to tolerable pain, as well as periods with relaxation.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study design is a randomised controlled crossover design, nested within two groups - one with a dog present (Dog) and another without a dog present (No Dog). Both groups will be subjected to a classical stress test - the Maastricht Acute Stress Test (MAST) and a pain test with periods of relaxation in between. The participants will be subjected to both test situations on the same day and in the same order.
On the test day, background information and baseline measures (baseline period, duration: 40 minutes) will be collected, whereafter the participants rest for 30 minutes (pre-intervention rest period). After this the participants are subjected to the two test situations, pain test (60 minutes, including calibration and two separate tests sessions) and MAST (15 minutes, including 5 min introduction) with 30 minutes of relaxation in between and a 40 min post-rest period The participants' interaction with the dog is recorded using quantitative behaviour sampling using predefined behavioural categories.
Most physiological and all behavioural measures are recorded continuously throughout test situations and relaxation, in order to be able to study the response to the stress situations and recovery, and the response to contact with dog, and to psychological responses. Some physiological measures obtained before and after each test situation.
Below the exact time schedule of the test day is shown and these times will be refered to when the outcome measures are described. The "Baseline period" (40 minutes) and the last 10 minutes where the equipment for physiological measures is removed is not included in the duration of the test period (174 minutes). All times are given in minutes.
Baseline period (40 minutes - not part of total test period)
- Pre-intervention period (start t = 0; end t = 30)
- Calibration for pain test (start t = 30, end t = 35)
- Rest period 1 (start t = 35, end t = 47)
- Pain test 1 (start t = 47, end t = 52)
- Post-pain test 1 (start t = 52, end, t= 62)
- Rest period 2 (start t = 62, end t = 74)
- Pain test 2 (start t = 74, end t = 79)
- Post-pain test 2 (start t = 79, end t = 89)
- Rest period 3 (start t = 89, end t = 119)
- MAST test (incl. introduction (start t = 119, end t = 134)
- Rest period 4 (start t = 134, end t = 174)

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, heart rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: The test person wears self-adhesive electrodes and the heart rate is measured non-invasively

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the end of the 30 minute pre-intervention period (t=30 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the end of Rest Period 1 (t=47 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured after Pain test 1 (t=52 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the end of Rest period 2 (t=74 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured after Pain test 2 (t=79 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the end of Rest period 3 (t=119 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured after MAST test (t=134 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, systolic and diastolic blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured after Rest period 4 (t=174 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure is measured manually with a blood pressure monitor with a blood pressure cuff.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological measure, heart rate variability
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate variability is calculated from heart rate data.

primary_outcome.measure: Galvanic skin response
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: The test person is fitted with electrodes on two fingers and galvanic skin response is measured non-invasively.

primary_outcome.measure: Salivary cortisol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the end of the 30 minute pre-intervention period (t=30 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Saliva is obtained from the test subject with a cotton swab which is chewed for one minute.

primary_outcome.measure: Salivary cortisol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the end of Rest Period 1 (t=47 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Saliva is obtained from the test subject with a cotton swab which is chewed for one minute

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured after Post-pain test 1 (t=62 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Saliva is obtained from the test subject with a cotton swab which is chewed for one minute

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scales measuring expected psychological and physiological effects of the test day including, including the two test situation and the rest periods
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: Measured at onset of the 30 minute pre-intervention period (t=0 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Test persons fill in a visual analogue scale. Minimum value -100 (very negative effect) and maximum value 100 (very positive effect), and 0 being neutral.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scales measuring expected psychological and physiological effects of the two test situations
primary_outcome.time_frame: : Measured immediately preceding Pain test 1 (t=47 minutes]
primary_outcome.description: Test persons fill in a visual analogue scale. Minimum value -100 (very negative effect) and maximum value 100 (very positive effect), and 0 being neutral.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scales measuring expected psychological and physiological effects of the two test situations
primary_outcome.time_frame: : Measured immediately preceding Pain test 2 (t=74 minutes]
primary_outcome.description: Test persons fill in a visual analogue scale. Minimum value -100 (very negative effect) and maximum value 100 (very positive effect), and 0 being neutral.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scales measuring expected psychological and physiological effects of the two test situations

primary_outcome.description: Test persons fill in a visual analogue scale. Minimum value -100 (very negative effect) and maximum value 100 (very positive effect), and 0 being neutral.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scales measuring perceived psychological and physiological effects of each of the two test situations
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately following Pain test 1(t=52 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Test persons fill in a visual analogue scale. Minimum value -100 (very negative effect) and maximum value 100 (very positive effect), and 0 being neutral.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analogue scales measuring perceived psychological and physiological effects of of the test day including the test situations and rest period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately after Rest period 4 (t=174 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Test persons fill in a visual analogue scale. Minimum value -100 (very negative effect) and maximum value 100 (very positive effect), and 0 being neutral.

primary_outcome.measure: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: Measured at onset of the 30 minute pre-intervention period preceding the first test situation (t=0 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: State anxiety is measured with the STAI-scale (minimum score= 20, maximum score= 80, and a lower score indicates a high anxiety level)

primary_outcome.measure: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately following Pain test 1 (t= 52 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: State anxiety is measured with the STAI-scale (minimum score= 20, maximum score= 80, and a lower score indicates a high anxiety level)

primary_outcome.measure: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately following Pain test 2 (t= 79 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: State anxiety is measured with the STAI-scale (minimum score= 20, maximum score= 80, and a lower score indicates a high anxiety level)

primary_outcome.measure: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately following MAST test 1 (t=134 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: State anxiety is measured with the STAI-scale (minimum score= 20, maximum score= 80, and a lower score indicates a high anxiety level)

primary_outcome.measure: The State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately after Rest period 4 (t=174 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: State anxiety is measured with the STAI-scale (minimum score= 20, maximum score= 80, and a lower score indicates a high anxiety level)

primary_outcome.measure: The Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: Measured at onset of the 30 minute pre-intervention period preceding the first test situation (t=0 minutes)]
primary_outcome.description: Positive and negative affect is measured with the PANAS scale, where the person scores whether or not they experience each of 20 emotions on a 5-step scale from "very little /not at all" to "extremely much". The emotions differ in valens.

primary_outcome.measure: The Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediately following Pain test 1 (t= 52 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Positive and negative affect is measured with the PANAS scale, where the person scores whether or not they experience each of 20 emotions on a 5-step scale from "very little /not at all" to "extremely much". The emotions differ in valens.

primary_outcome.description: Positive and negative affect is measured with the PANAS scale, where the person scores whether or not they experience each of 20 emotions on a 5-step scale from "very little /not at all" to "extremely much". The emotions differ in valens.

primary_outcome.description: Positive and negative affect is measured with the PANAS scale, where the person scores whether or not they experience each of 20 emotions on a 5-step scale from "very little /not at all" to "extremely much". The emotions differ in valens.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - frequencies of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for frequency of sitting.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - frequencies of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for frequency of standing.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - frequencies of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for frequency of walking.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - frequencies of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for frequency of touching the dog (being in physical contact with the dog with the hand or another part of the body, only in the arm: Dog)

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - frequencies of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for frequency of looking at the dog (having the head turned towards the dog, only in the arm: Dog).

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - frequencies of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for frequency of talking to the dog (Only in the arm: Dog).

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - duration of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for the duration (seconds) of sitting.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - duration of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for the duration (seconds) of standing.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - duration of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for the duration (seconds) of walking.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - duration of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for the duration (seconds) of touching the dog (being in physical contact with the dog with the hand or another part of the body, only in the arm: Dog).

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - duration of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for the duration (seconds) of looking at the dog (having the head turned towards the dog, only in the arm: Dog).

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative behavioural measures - duration of behavioural elements
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured continuously throughout the total test period of 174 minutes (starting in the pre-intervention period and during the following test situations and all resting periods)]
primary_outcome.description: A video recording of the test persons behaviour is analysed for the duration (seconds) of talking to the dog (Only in the arm: Dog).

clinical_study.condition: Physiological Stress Responses to Standardises Stress Situations
Psychological Responses to Standardised Stress Situations
Behavioural Responses to Standardised Stress Situations

arm_group.description: Being subjected to two standardised stress situations with a dog and its handler present
Being subjected to two standardised stress situations without a dog present, but in the presence of a person (dog handler)

intervention.description: Subjection to standardised stress situations in the presence of a dog and a person
Subjection to standardised stress situations in the presence of a person

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal cognitive functioning and physical movement
- Ability to speak and read Danish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known medical, psychiatric or neurological disease
- Use of psychotropic medications
- Frequent use of pain medication
- Use of illegal psychotropic drugs
- Known allergies to dogs
